titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Westmoreland (Va.) Court Records, 1770 - 1910
titlestmt.subtitle: Winchester (Va.) Court Records Barcode Numbers 1042806 - 1176645

titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Westmoreland (Va.) Court Records, 1770-1910
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia Barcode Numbers 1042806 - 1176645

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Westmoreland(Va.) Court Records, 1770 - 1910. Local government records collection , Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in shipments of court papers from Westmoreland Va.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Westmoreland County was named for the English county. It was formed from Northumberland County in 1653, and part of King George County was added in 1777. Its area is 229 square miles, and the county seat is Montross.
The court records described in this guide were generated in the following courts, Circuit Superior Court of Law and Chancery, County Court and the Superior Court of Law

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Westmoreland (Va.) Court Records 1770 - 1910 includes the following series; Chancery Execution Book, Clerk's Records, Docket Books, Executions, Executions Returned, Executions/Justices' Report, Extracts of Judgments, Judgment Dockets, Jury Records, Justices Executions/Executions Returned, Law Process Books, Memorandum Book, Office Judgments, Orders at Law, Register of Convicts.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional City of Westmoreland Court Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm
